isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: ROCKWELL WABCO 4 CHANNEL

svcsection.title: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: ROCKWELL WABCO 4 CHANNEL

lev1.para: The Rockwell WABCO Antilock Brake System (ABS) is an electronic system that monitors and controls wheel speed during braking. The system works with standard air brake systems. Figure 1shows a typical four-channel ABS configuration. The ABS monitors the wheel speed at all times and controls the braking during emergency situations by reducing wheel lock during braking.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Rockwell WABCO Antilock Brake System (ABS)

lev2.title: Tooth Wheel
lev2.para: The tooth wheel has a 100 teeth surface, and is mounted to a machined surface on the hub of each monitored wheel ( Figure 2).

lev2.title: Electronic Control (ECU)
lev2.para: The ECU ( Figure 3) is the brain of the system. The ECU receives information from sensors, and sends signals to the ABS valves. The ECU is mounted on the frame of the vehicle.

lev2.title: Sensor
lev2.para: A sensor ( Figure 4) is installed so that its end is against the tooth wheel. The sensor continuously sends wheel speed information to the ECU. On 4-channel ABS, a sensor is installed at each front wheel and a sensor is installed on both wheels of one rear axle. The sensors on the steer axle are installed in the steering knuckle. The sensors on the drive axle are mounted in a block attached to the axle housing.

lev2.title: Sensor Clip
lev2.para: The sensor clip ( Figure 5) holds the sensor in place in the steering knuckle and in the block on the rear axle housing.

lev2.title: ABS Modulator Valve
lev2.para: The ABS modulator valve ( Figure 6) controls air pressure to each affected brake during the ABS function.

During normal braking, compressed air flows through the ABS valve to the brake chamber. During ABS operation, the ABS valve adjusts air pressure to the brake chambers to control braking and prevent wheel lock.

lev2.title: Warning Light
lev2.para: The ABS warning light is mounted on the dash and will come on when the ignition switch is turned on, and will go off when the speed of the vehicle reaches approximately 4 mph (6 km/h). If the light stays on, or comes on at any other time, it signals a malfunction in the ABS. When this occurs, standard braking is returned to the vehicle. In many cases, part of the ABS function may still be available.

lev2.title: ATC Light
lev2.para: If the ATC (spin-indicator) light (optional feature) is installed on the dash, it comes on when the drive wheels spin during acceleration. The light goes off when the wheel spin stops.

lev2.title: ATC
lev2.para: ATC uses two solenoid valves, two double-check valves and a wiring harness with ATC connectors ( Figure 1). The air line between the ATC valve and the double check valve must gradually slope toward the ATC valve. This allows condensation to drain out of the ATC valve exhaust.
